intro: Rauvolfia sevenetii, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in cymes. Its roots are notable for containing alkaloids, which have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Rauvolfia sevenetii thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
